verse: The Lord then recruited and deployed 70 more disciples. He sent them ahead, in teams of two, to visit all the towns and settlements between them and Jerusalem.
When the 70 completed their mission and returned to report on their experiences, they were elated.
Then Jesus Himself became elated. The Holy Spirit was on Him, and He began to pray with joy.
Just then a scholar of the Hebrew Scriptures tried to trap Jesus.
The scholar was frustrated by this response because he was hoping to make himself appear smarter than Jesus.
Jesus continued from there toward Jerusalem and came to another village. Martha, a resident of that village, welcomed Jesus into her home.
Her sister, Mary, went and sat at Jesusâ€™ feet, listening to Him teach.
Meanwhile Martha was anxious about all the hospitality arrangements.
